intro: Herschelianthe lacera, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green to yellowish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the milkweed family. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability. Herschelianthe lacera plays a role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
